tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customer_responses (
    response_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    response_date DATE,
    response_type VARCHAR(50),
    response_content TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE campaign_conversions (
    conversion_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    conversion_date DATE,
    conversion_type VARCHAR(50),
    conversion_value DECIMAL(10,2)
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerResponses
(
   customer_id INT,
   response_status VARCHAR,
   response_date DATE,
   PRIMARY KEY (customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Conversions
(
   conversion_id INT,
   customer_id INT,
   conversion_date DATE,
   conversion_value DECIMAL,
   PRIMARY KEY (conversion_id),
   FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES CustomerResponses(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerEngagement
(
   customer_id INT,
   engagement_score INT,
   engagement_date DATE,
   PRIMARY KEY (customer_id),
   FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES CustomerResponses(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CampaignResults
(
   result_id INT,
   campaign_id INT,
   conversion_id INT,
   engagement_score INT,
   result_date DATE,
   PRIMARY KEY (result_id),
   FOREIGN KEY (conversion_id) REFERENCES Conversions(conversion_id),
   FOREIGN KEY (engagement_score) REFERENCES CustomerEngagement(engagement_score)
);

CREATE TABLE customer_responses (
  response_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id UUID,
  campaign_id UUID,
  response_date DATE,
  response_type VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE conversions (
  conversion_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id UUID,
  campaign_id UUID,
  conversion_date DATE,
  conversion_type VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE engagement (
  engagement_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id UUID,
  campaign_id UUID,
  engagement_date DATE,
  engagement_type VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE campaign_metrics (
  metric_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  campaign_id UUID,
  impressions INT,
  clicks INT,
  conversions INT
);

CREATE TABLE customer_data (
  customer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  first_name VARCHAR,
  last_name VARCHAR,
  email VARCHAR,
  phone_number VARCHAR
);
